Installation¶

NWB Standardization Codes Installation¶

  1. Download the NWB Standardization Codes.

  2. Change the folder name ‘NMRCNWBStandardization-master’ to ‘NMRCNWBStandardization’

  3. add path and subpath of NWB Standardization Codes into matlab:

    addpath(genpath('path/to/NWB Standardization Code'))

savepath

Used Toolboxes Installation¶

Important

Please installed the following toolboxes before using NWB standardized processing codes.

MatNWB¶

MatNWB is the Matlab interface for reading and writing NWB file. To generate and use NWB structure, MatNWB should be inside the folder /util/.

  1. Download the MatNWB.

  2. Change the folder name ‘matnwb-master’ to ‘matnwb’

  3. From the Matlab command line, generate matlab m-files inside matnwb folder:

    generateCore('schema/core/nwb.namespace.yaml');

  4. Copy the folder matnwb into folder NMRCNWBStandardization/toolbox/

  5. add MatNWB path and its subpath to matlab

TDTMatlabSDK¶

TDTMatlabSDK is the Matlab TDT data import tool. TDTMatlabSDK should be inside the folder /util/ when converting tdt data to NWB structure.

  1. Download the zipped TDTMatlabSDK tool.

  2. Extrac the zip files into folder toolbox/

  3. add TDTMatlabSDK path and its subpath to matlab
